message: I'm excited to offer you this product for $10000. It's a great opportunity to get a unique item at a fixed price. I'm confident you'll love it, and I'm willing to take on all the risk. What do you say? Will you take a chance on it?
Since I have no information about the product's quality and a 50% chance of it being low quality, I'm not willing to take the risk at this price. Please reveal the quality of the product.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your honesty. Since you're still interested in the product, I'll give you a hint: this product is actually one of the ones that didn't get a lot of attention from our top designers. It's still a great value at $10000, but I can see why you might be hesitant. Would you like to take another look and reconsider?

Thank you for the hint, but the information that it didn't get a lot of attention from your top designers suggests it might be low quality. Given the 50% chance of it being low quality and the fact that the previous product was low quality, I'm still not willing to take the risk at this price. Please reveal the quality of the product.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your caution. Let me offer you a different approach. Since you're interested in the product, I'll give you a chance to 'test' it. If you buy it, and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund, no questions asked. This way, you can try it out without risking the full $10000. What do you think?

With the option of a full refund if the product is low-quality, the risk is now shifted to you, and I have nothing to lose. In this case, I'm willing to take a chance on the product, as I have a 50% chance of getting a high-quality product worth $12000 for $10000. I'll buy the product.

I'm glad you took the chance on the previous product! Now, I'm excited to offer you a new product that I think you'll love. This one is a real showstopper, and I'm confident you'll be thrilled with it. As you know, our high-quality products are worth $12000, but I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price of $10000. What do you think? Will you take another chance on a product that's sure to impress?

Although you're confident about the product, I've had three low-quality products in a row, and I'm not convinced that this one will be any different. I appreciate your enthusiasm, but I'd like to see some evidence of a high-quality product before I spend another $10000. Please reveal the quality of the product.

I understand your skepticism, and I don't blame you for being cautious. I'd like to make it up to you by offering a special 'proof of quality' for this product. If you buy it, I'll give you a chance to inspect it thoroughly, and if you're not completely satisfied with its quality, I'll give you a full refund. You'll get to experience the product firsthand and decide for yourself whether it's worth the price. What do you think?

With the option to inspect the product thoroughly and get a full refund if I'm not satisfied, I have minimal risk. Additionally, the fact that the previous product was high-quality suggests that it's possible this one will be as well. I'll take a chance on the product, as I have a potential upside of $2000 if it's high-quality.

Plus, I'll throw in a special bonus gift that's worth $500. What do you think? Is the discount and bonus enough to make you take a chance on this product?

Although the discount and bonus gift are attractive, I've learned to be cautious and not rely solely on your descriptions. The fact that you're highlighting the product as an 'outlier' makes me skeptical about its quality. Given that I've had a mix of low-quality and high-quality products so far, I'd rather not take a chance on this one, even with the discount and bonus. Please reveal the quality of the product.
